snippet: The policy, by the Roman Catholic Diocese of Harrisburg, said that boys’ and girls’ competing together in such sports would be in conflict with its religious mission.
abstract: Roman Catholic Diocese of Harrisburg in Pennsylvania adopts a policy requiring boys on its school wrestling teams to forfeit matches against female opponents; policy also bars girls from joining Catholic schools' tackle football and rugby teams.
lead_paragraph: The policy, by the Roman Catholic Diocese of Harrisburg, said that boys’ and girls’ competing together in such sports would be in conflict with its religious mission.

headline.main: Diocese Bars Girls From Playing Contact Sports With Boys
headline.print_headline: A Ban on Coed Contact Sports
